newsitem.title: USA: Container lessors seek $55 mln from Venezuela.
newsitem.headline: Container lessors seek $55 mln from Venezuela.

text.p: Twelve container and equipment leasing companies from the U.S., England and Italy said Monday that they are jointly suing the Republic of Venezuela for breach of contract to recover $55 million.

They argue the government encouraged CAVN, the state-owned carrier Compania Anonima Venezolana de Navegacion, to become an inefficient bureaucracy dependent upon government financial support and then turned on the container companies which had provided equipment.
The plaintiffs allege the Venezuelan government repudiated agreements with North American and other investors.
The lessors are represented by the New York City law firm of Schnader, Harrison, Segal & Lewis.

The equipment leasing companies filing Monday in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia are Transamerica Corp's Transamerica Leasing Inc and Trans Ocean Container Corp, Triton Container International Ltd, Matson Leasing Co Inc, Sea Containers Ltd's Sea Containers America Inc and Sea Containers Italia srl, XTRA Corp, Flexi-Van Leasing Inc, Interpool Ltd, Trac Lease Inc, Bridgehead Container Services Ltd, and Cronos Container Ltd.
Specifically, the companies allege containers and equipment they leased to the Republic of Venezuela through CAVN were neither paid for nor returned.

They further allege the government broke numerous agreements and promises to pay, forcing the container companies to incur substantial losses and pay substantial amounts of ransom to retrieve some of their containers.
